abstract_summ: Lockdowns may not be the answer in Africa and the issue of public health pandemic response will need to be addressed by enacting context-specific policies which should be implemented in a humane way.These measures were more pronounced in sub-Sahara Africa while oil-rich countries of the North mostly have broad economic measures that target their oil and gas sectors.The cost of the pandemic and economic shocks will increase significantly when several countries in the region experience the pandemic shock concurrently.The energy sector is of no exception, with several concerns being raised about the ramifications that will arise for the clean energy transition.As governments take measures to bolster their economies, they must pay particular attention to the challenges posed by the pandemic in the energy sector and capitalize on the opportunities that it presents to drive the clean energy transition.

title_abstract_phrases: We conclude that a complex combination of the characteristics of the current COVID‐19 crisis, the institutional experience of dealing with previous pandemic and epidemic crises, government support schemes, as well as regional industrial structures, might potentially affect the recovery and resilience rates of Chinese regions.Lockdowns may not be the answer in Africa and the issue of public health pandemic response will need to be addressed by enacting context-specific policies which should be implemented in a humane way.It is critical that developing countries find innovative policy mechanisms to achieve sustainability and development aims in a cost-effective manner.These measures were more pronounced in sub-Sahara Africa while oil-rich countries of the North mostly have broad economic measures that target their oil and gas sectors.The energy sector is of no exception, with several concerns being raised about the ramifications that will arise for the clean energy transition.
